Carmel Clay Schools will provide your school-aged children with supplemental food during this closure. If you need supplemental food assistance for your student, please complete the form by March 30th
https://forms.gle/McM1ro1wcwjDuToe8.

You only need to complete the form once to continue receiving supplemental food services.

Next Food Pick Up: Wednesday, April 1
Pick up window: 11:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m.
Pick Up Location: Carmel High School, Door #9 Please see Map here: shorturl.at/IOX07
Families are to stay in their vehicles in the Carmel High School carpool line, as the supplemental food packs will be delivered directly to the vehicle by CCS staff.

On April 1, the volunteers of Merciful Help Center will be providing the supplemental food packs for this next pick up. Food packs will contain breakfast items and lunch meals to supplement students' food availability at home through April 14. On April 15, Carmel Clay Schools will be providing the food packs. Pick up location for both April 1 and April 15 will be at Carmel High School.

Carmel Youth Assistance Program
March 26 at 10:41 AM ·

On April 1, the Merciful H.E.L.P. Center will be providing food for 750 registered students ahead of Carmel Clay School's spring break April 3-10. Thanks to your generous financial donations in 2019, we are able to provide funding to help offset some of the costs of these meals, however, the need this year is much higher than anticipated due to many families struggling during this time. They are welcoming additional donations of food or financial help to cover these meals.

Specifically, the following items are being asked for:
* Mac and Cheese - full boxes
* Juice Boxes
* Boxes of Cereal
* Pasta
* Tuna
* 750 rolls of toilet paper

Any donations may be dropped off to the Merciful H.E.L.P. Center at 1045 West 146th Street, Suite A, Carmel.

Carmel High School has been chosen as one of the few recipients of the German American Partnership Program (GAPP) “School of Distinction” by the US Department of State and the German Federal Foreign Office! The GAPP “School of Distinction” award is given to schools, which have shown an exceptional partnership in fostering long-term German American youth exchanges between the US and Germany and have made a difference in their school, community, and beyond.

In the pursuit of language learning, fostering mutual understanding and cultural awareness, Carmel High School students are then given the opportunity to spent 3 weeks in Germany, live with host families and attend school in a foreign country. Throughout the years, this life-changing experience has helped hundreds of CHS students grow as global citizens and Carmel High School is very honored to be recognized.

The Carmel Clay Schools board voted unanimously on Monday, January 13, 2020 to name the new elementary school between 116th and Clay Center Road, Clay Center Elementary School!

The recommendation to name the new elementary school on Clay Center Road was derived from historical information found in the book, The Early History of Carmel Clay Schools, written by A.J. Wright with the Carmel Historical Society. Mr. Wright’s research found that on September 25, 1912, Clay Township opened a new brick school, named Clay Center, on the northeast corner of 116th Street and Clay Center Road. The district’s new elementary school will be located north of where the original Clay Center school was built.

Clay Center Elementary School will open in August 2021. The school’s mascot and colors have yet to be determined, but the district looks forward to getting students involved in the selection process.

(Photo below is of the original Clay Center School in 1912.)

Our school board members give our community a voice in educational decision-making. In addition, they are fierce advocates for public education at the local, state and national level. Their contribution is a year-round, four-year commitment with several members serving multiple terms over the years.

We are extremely thankful for our CCS School Board! Please join us in celebrating our school board members this week!
